'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[public company|public corporation]], specializing in [[Internet search]]ing and [[online advertising]]. The company is similar to websites like Yahoo.[[Media:Example.ogg]] The company is based in [[Mountain View, California]], and has 12,238 full-time employees (as of [[March 31]] [[2007]]).<ref>"[http://www.google.com/press/pressrel/revenues_q107.html Google Announces First Quarter 2007 Results]." April 19, 2007. Retrieved on [[April 22]] [[2007]].</ref> Google's mission statement is "to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful."<ref>"[http://www.google.com/corporate/ Google Corporate Information: Company Overview]." ''Google.'' Retrieved on January 6, 2007.</ref> Google's corporate philosophy includes statements such as, "You can make money without doing evil," and, "Work should be challenging and the challenge should be fun," illustrating a somewhat more relaxed corporate culture.
+
'''Google Inc.''' ({{nasdaq|GOOG}} and {{lse|GGEA}}) is an [[United States|American]] [[public company|public corporation]], specializing in [[Internet search]]ing and [[online advertising]]. The company is similar to websites like Yahoo. The company is based in [[Mountain View, California]], and has 12,238 full-time employees (as of [[March 31]] [[2007]]).<ref>"[http://www.google.com/press/pressrel/revenues_q107.html Google Announces First Quarter 2007 Results]." April 19, 2007. Retrieved on [[April 22]] [[2007]].</ref> Google's mission statement is "to organize the world's information and make it universally accessible and useful."<ref>"[http://www.google.com/corporate/ Google Corporate Information: Company Overview]." ''Google.'' Retrieved on January 6, 2007.</ref> Google's corporate philosophy includes statements such as, "You can make money without doing evil," and, "Work should be challenging and the challenge should be fun," illustrating a somewhat more relaxed corporate culture.
Google was co-founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while they were students at [[Stanford University]], and the company was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 7]] [[1998]]. Google's [[initial public offering]] took place on [[August 19]] [[2004]], raising [[United States Dollar|USD]]1.67 billion, making it worth $23 billion. Through a series of new product developments, acquisitions and partnerships, the company has expanded its initial search and advertising business into other areas, including web-based [[email]], online mapping, office productivity, and video sharing, among others.
Google was co-founded by [[Larry Page]] and [[Sergey Brin]] while they were students at [[Stanford University]], and the company was first incorporated as a [[privately held company]] on [[September 7]] [[1998]]. Google's [[initial public offering]] took place on [[August 19]] [[2004]], raising [[United States Dollar|USD]]1.67 billion, making it worth $23 billion. Through a series of new product developments, acquisitions and partnerships, the company has expanded its initial search and advertising business into other areas, including web-based [[email]], online mapping, office productivity, and video sharing, among others.
